intro: Vernonanthura brasiliana, commonly known as the Brazilian starflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. The leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
